subject: Notice of Slack’s new content deletion policy for free workspaces
body:
Free workspace content older than one year will be deleted
We wanted to let you know about a change in policy for free workspaces.
What is changing?
Workspaces’ data, including files, messages, and other content that is older than one year will no longer be stored. Free workspaces will continue to have full access to the past 90 days of message history and file storage. This change will not impact workspaces on other plans, such as Slack Pro.
When will this take effect?
This policy will begin taking effect August 26th, 2024. Workspaces will be notified prior to the policy impacting their workspace.
What does this mean for you?
Your workspace, Slack , is on a free Slack plan. This workspace has content that is older than one year which will be deleted once the policy takes effect. Moving forward, Slack will not retain messages and files older than one year for a workspace. This policy will impact your workspace starting August 26th, 2024.
To retain access to content older than a year, the workspace needs to be on a paid Slack plan. These plans can be reviewed on our plan page. Free teams will continue to retain access to messages and content sent in the last 90 days.
If your team chooses to upgrade to a paid plan after the policy goes into effect, you will not be able to recover any content that has been deleted under our new policy.
S
Slack
Workspace URL: slack-hik4376.slack.com
SIGN IN
Questions? Review our FAQs about this policy change.
Our Blog   |   Policies   |   Help Center   |   Slack Community

©2024 Slack Technologies, LLC, a Salesforce company.
415 Mission Street, San Francisco, CA 94105

All rights reserved.

subject: Your account has been officially activated!
body:
Paid Account has been activated!
Dear Damien Foucard,
Congratulations! Your paid account has been officially activated. It enables you to make payments for your services at Database Mart or request free trials.
If you haven't chosen any services with us, go to the control panel to choose one. 
We enclose the following guide articles and FAQs, hoping to make it easy for you to complete payments.
  Step-by-Step Guides:
How to Make Payment for Your Service
Payment Issues ( PayPal & Credit Card )
  FAQs:
When are invoices generated?
Invoices are generated 5 days before the due date of packages, which show your plan level, billing cycle, and add-ons. You could also change any of those before the payments and generate a new invoice.
What happens if my invoices remain unpaid?
If a service invoice remains unpaid, your package will be suspended 3 days past due and be canceled 4 days past due. Please make sure to pay the service invoice before it is due.
When will auto-payments be made?
If you have subscribed to our services and have added a default payment method, our system will handle recurring payments the day the next billing cycle starts.
  If you need any further assistance, please feel free to let us know. We are always here for you.
Sincerely,
Database Mart LLC
  Chat |
Submit Ticket|
FAQ|
Help Document|
Affiliate|
Facebook|
YouTube

subject: [0A0-2E0D7D1C-0093] Upgrading to Professional GPU VPS - A4000 for the rest of the plan
body:
Hey,

1) Now you are using our Basic Dedicated GPU Server-K40, its GPU module is M40, and the RAM is 64GB.
Ok. Thanks for the heads-up. I checked again and we are not really limited by RAM, so 32G RAM would be ok.

2) Would you still would like to change the plan from the current Basic Dedicated GPU Server-K40 to our Professional GPU VPS - A4000 and keep the new plan until July 2025? If yes, we will help you place a new Professional GPU VPS - A4000 order with Ubuntu 20 OS. Is that alfight for you? 
Yes, perfect. Thank you so much.

Best,
Damien

subject: Upgrading to Professional GPU VPS - A4000 for the rest of the plan
body:
Hi,
Thanks for reaching us.
Yes if you would like to upgrade the performance of current server, the GPU VPS A4000 seems not being a good choice for you.  First of all, GPU VPS servers shares the resources on the same hosts, moreover, the GPU VPS server comes with less RAM and disk resources. Advanced dedicated GPU server A4000 should fit your request better than VPS.
Please let us know if you are interested or you insist to upgrade the server to GPU VPS A4000.
  Sincerely,

Jonathan L
Database Mart Support Department
http://www.databasemart.com
  From: Ada Struct <adastruct@gmail.com>
Sent: Tue, 25 Jun 2024 08:05:32 -0500
To: Database Mart LLC <support@databasemart.com>
Subject: Upgrading to Professional GPU VPS - A4000 for the rest of the plan

subject: Ihre Einladung: AWS Summit EMEA - On-Demand Hub
body:
Erleben Sie die AWS Summits jederzeit und überall
    Wir freuen uns, Sie zum AWS Summit EMEA On-Demand Hub einzuladen, für alles Wissenswerte rund um Cloud, Daten und KI. Sie erhalten unbegrenzten Zugriff auf über 100 spannende Sessions, darunter technische Präsentationen, Kundenbeispielen und Demos.

Erkunden Sie die Zukunft der Cloud-Technologie jetzt bequem wann und wo Sie möchten.
    Jetzt ansehen

    Verfügbare Inhalte
    Wir freuen uns, Ihnen mitteilen zu können, dass die neuesten Sessions des AWS Summit Berlin 2024 jetzt auf dem AWS Summit On-Demand Hub verfügbar sind. Sie erhalten zusätzlich auch Zugang zu den Vorträgen der AWS Summits in London, Amsterdam und Paris. Zu den Inhalten gehören unter anderem:
      Keynotes
In diesen inspirierenden Sessions können Sie die neuesten AWS-Innovationen und wichtigsten Technologietrends anhand von Anwendungsfällen von Kunden kennenlernen.
      Generative KI
Entdecken Sie die revolutionären Fähigkeiten von generativer KI und lernen Sie, wie Sie Produkte wie Amazon Q, Amazon SageMaker und Amazon Bedrock nutzen können.
      Daten und Analysen
Optimieren Sie die Verwaltung und Analyse Ihrer Daten mit Best Practices und spezialisierten AWS-Services.
      Sicherheit
Erhöhen Sie die Sicherheit Ihrer Anwendungen und Infrastruktur mit branchenführenden Cybersicherheitslösungen von AWS.
    Mehr erfahren
    Freundliche Grüße
Ihr AWS-Team
                          Eigenes Konto | Jetzt loslegen | Produkte | Lösungen | Preise | Partner | Dokumentation | Training | Veranstaltungen & Webinare | AWS Activate | Marketplace | Neuigkeiten | Blog | Berichte von Analysten
Online ansehen
  Wenn Sie zukünftig keine E-Mails mehr von Amazon Web Services erhalten möchten, können Sie sich hier abmelden.
Amazon Web Services, Inc. ist eine Tochtergesellschaft von Amazon.com, Inc. Amazon.com ist eine eingetragene Marke von Amazon.com.

subject: June admin update
body:
JUNE 2024
Slack Admin Updates

Read on to prepare yourselves and your members for new capabilities, changes and deprecations.
WHAT'S NEW
What’s new or currently rolling out:
  Channel manager invitation restrictions (Enterprise Grid)
Channel managers can restrict members and guests from inviting others to private channels, making it so that only channel managers and admins will be able to invite users to the channel.
Learn more ‌ →
  Integrate Google Calendar and Microsoft Outlook with Slack OOO
A new option allows members to automatically set their Slack status to “out of office” when set in Google Calendar or Microsoft Outlook.
Learn more ‌ →
  New channel audit report export type (Enterprise Grid, Business+)
The channel audit and channel membership audit is available for eligible customers to self-serve via the Exports page in Slack. This additional export type will be available to primary owners and owners. Enterprise Grid customers can also assign additional members the Export Admin system role.
Learn more ‌ →
  Corporate email restrictions (Enterprise Grid)
A new setting allows org owners to block members from joining external workspaces with their corporate email address.
Learn more ‌ →
  Trigger curation for Workflow Builder admins (Enterprise Grid)
Owners and admins can now control which triggers can be used to build workflows. This functionality mirrors the existing controls for managing Workflow Builder steps.
Learn more ‌ →
  New setting to require org owners to log in with SSO (Enterprise Grid)
Any Org Owner can enable a new setting to require that all Org Owners always sign in to Slack via SSO (rather than bypassing SSO to sign in with their email address and password).
Learn more ‌ →
  Custom DLP messaging (Enterprise Grid)
DLP admins have the option to set up custom text for tombstone rules and “Show a warning” rules. Text can be customized on a rule-by-rule basis.
Learn more ‌ →
  Audit Logs dashboard enhancements (Enterprise Grid)
The Audit Logs dashboard has a new Security Detections tab that centralizes all anomaly audit logs so that admins and Audit Log Admins can easily filter and analyze their anomaly audit logs. The existing view Full Log Details modal will now also include anomaly “reason” definitions.
Learn more ‌ →
  Legacy permissions migration
Slack’s 20 existing legacy permissions will be migrating to the Account Types dashboard to streamline permissions administration.
Learn more ‌ →
  Request to join a huddle
When a member uses a huddle link to join a huddle in a conversation they don’t have access to, they can request to join.
COMING SOON
  Slack lists
Lists is a new surface where teams can manage tasks, requests, issues and more in Slack.
  Monthly active user data
The overview dashboard displays data showing monthly active users—the number of people who have read or sent a message in at least one channel or direct message at least once in the past 28 days within a given workspace. Enterprise Grid organizations will also be able to access this data at the org level.
  Shared sidebar sections, powered by user groups
A new option will allow a user group’s default channels to automatically appear as a shared section in all group members’ sidebars instead of the channels showing in the catchall “Channels” section.
  Important changes to legacy workflows
Following the release of the new version of Workflow Builder in September 2023, we announced the deprecation of the legacy version of Workflow Builder. As part of this deprecation, you will no longer be able to create legacy workflows, use legacy templates, or copy existing legacy workflows as of June 24, 2024.
Learn more ‌ →
  Visibility into channel canvas edits
Members will have the option to share canvas updates within the channel. Channel members will see a message indicating that changes have been made to the canvas.
  Custom roles (Enterprise Grid)
Admins will have the ability to select from a menu of permissions, then name and assign that role to individual members or IDP groups.
Upcoming deprecations
  32-bit Slack desktop app for Windows
Starting with the release of desktop app version 4.39 in June 2024, Slack will no longer release a 32-bit app for Windows. Users on version 4.38 and below can continue using the 32-bit client until their app version reaches the end of its support lifecycle.
Learn more ‌ →

Email link to sign in on mobile functionality is retiring on July 24, 2024
The option to sign in on mobile with a link emailed to your device will be retired in July. Users can instead scan a QR code with their mobile device when logged in on desktop.

OS, app and browser versions reaching end of support on September 1, 2024
In accordance with our support lifecycle policy, we have discontinued support for a number of operating systems, app versions and browsers.
Learn more ‌ →

Google Calendar for Team Events app will be retired on September 10, 2024
With the launch of a newer Google Calendar app, we will be retiring support for the legacy Google Calendar for Team Events app. The newer app offers enhanced features, including the ability to send calendar notifications to channels.
Learn more ‌ →

Legacy desktop configurations will be deprecated on September 17, 2024
With the introduction of a streamlined desktop app configuration, the following legacy configurations are redundant and will be deprecated.
Slack default sign-in on all platforms. See the default sign-in file
Environment-variable SLACK_NO_AUTO_UPDATES on Mac and Windows
The user preference SlackNoAutoUpdates on Mac. See disable automatic updates


Designated channels for flagged messages will be retired on September 17, 2024
Designated channels for flagged message review are being retired, and flagged messages will instead be reviewed from the admin dashboard. Organizations currently using a designated channel can view and take action on outstanding messages from the channel, but newly flagged messages will be sent to the dashboard.
Learn more ‌ →

Files.upload API will be retired on March 11, 2025
Any new applications created on or after this date will be prevented from invoking the files.upload API. Full deprecation will take place on March 11, 2025. To prepare for this change, we recommend migrating away from files.upload and instead using the combination of files.getUploadURLExternal and files.completeUploadExternal. More information on how to use these two APIs together can be found on our Uploading files documentation.

Upcoming changes to legacy bots and classic apps
Beginning on June 4, 2024, you will no longer be able to create legacy custom integration bot users or classic Slack apps.
Learn more ‌ →

HELP CENTER
